intro: Aristeguietia gascae, commonly known as the Ecuadorian evergreen, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest habitats at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually small and white or greenish, with five petals, and it produces small, fleshy berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
